channel.title: javascript on Professional Blog
channel.description: Recent content in javascript on Professional Blog

item.title: Links to Projects
item.description: Occasionally, I’ll write small largely stand-alone projects. If they are static HTML & Javascript-based, then creating them as Github pages, available as sub-directories on this site (beyond all the existing pages here) can be a quick and easy way to show them. However, there’s not been a good way to link to them, and show them off - so this is just the introduction to the new page in the menu above - and the link to some of my projects.

item.title: Projects
item.description: 2001: Lets keep it simple I designed these flag options a long time ago, around the year 2001, following some discussion (and a competition) on the main moon society mailing list regarding a flag. Several were produced, but they were all very complicated. This was my idea. Thoughts for a Luna flag. September 2019 On my second visit to An Evening Of Unnecessary Detail, Geoff Marshall (and Vicki!) were one of the guests on-stage.
